rating_recipe_correlation_analysis.create_data_part1()[source]ÔÉÅ

Create and clean the first part of the data.

This function loads and merges multiple CSV files, drops unnecessary columns, renames columns, removes outliers, and returns the cleaned DataFrame.

Returns:

Cleaned DataFrame for the first part of the data.

Return type:

DataFrame

rating_recipe_correlation_analysis.main()[source]ÔÉÅ

Main function to analyze recipe data.

This function initializes and cleans the data, performs various analyses, and prints the results. It includes distribution plots, correlation matrices, quartile calculations, and linear regression analyses.

Returns:

None

  • RO (str) ‚Äì Column name in the second DataFrame to join on.

rating_recipe_correlation_analysis.rating_distribution(df, variable, rating_var, low_threshold, mean_range, high_threshold, bins=[-inf, 2, 3, 4, inf], labels=['Less than 2', '2 to 3', '3 to 4', '4 to 5'])[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the distribution of ratings for a given variable and return a stacked bar chart.

Args: - df (DataFrame): DataFrame containing the data. - variable (str): Name of the variable to analyze. - rating_var (str): Name of the rating variable. - low_threshold (float): Lower threshold for low categories. - mean_range (tuple): Range for medium categories. - high_threshold (float): Upper threshold for high categories. - bins (list): Bins for rating categories (default: [float(‚Äò-inf‚Äô), 2, 3, 4, float(‚Äòinf‚Äô)]). - labels (list): Labels for the bins (default: [‚ÄòLess than 2‚Äô, ‚Äò2 to 3‚Äô, ‚Äò3 to 4‚Äô, ‚Äò4 to 5‚Äô]).
